meanings.definition: A drink, typically alcoholic, taken before a meal to stimulate the appetite.
meanings.sent1: The aperitif was a refreshing cocktail that made everyone excited for dinner.
meanings.sent2: We enjoyed a glass of aperitif before our meal to whet our appetites.
meanings.sent3: The aperitif was so tasty that we almost forgot about the main course!
meanings.sent4: The aperitif was like a prelude to a symphony of flavors that followed during the meal.
meanings.sent5: The aperitif, with its fruity notes, danced on our taste buds, preparing us for the feast ahead.

meanings.definition: A small amount of food or drink served before a meal to stimulate the appetite.
meanings.sent1: The waiter brought us a delightful aperitif of olives and cheese to nibble on.
meanings.sent2: The aperitif of soup was a perfect start to our dinner, warming us up for the main course.
meanings.sent3: The aperitif of crackers and dip was so good, we almost filled up before the main meal!
meanings.sent4: The aperitif of shrimp cocktail was a teaser for the seafood feast that awaited us.
meanings.sent5: The aperitif, a tiny glass of sparkling cider, was like a prelude to the banquet that followed.
